column3: I tested my compilation with last commit - everything was compiled!\nSo I think this patch is OK\nIf you need I can remake this patch to one single commit (in Monday)

> The second parameter of evhttp_connection_get_peer in libevent already has type as `const char **` The compilation of bitcoind with the fresh libevent occurs errors\n\nThere were no upstream releases for now since the commit https://github.com/libevent/libevent/commit/a18301a2bb160ff7c3ffaf5b7653c39ffe27b385 has been merged, right?

@hebasto I used the master branch of libevent so this commit definitely merged. I am not sure about new releases of libevent with this commit. The old versions have `char **` type for the second parameter. So I patched through preprocessor of C++. I see that all tests are passed. I compiled the bitcoind too with these patches.
I rebased these patches to the one patch and rebased on current master branch
Please update the PR title to be clearer. "evhttp_connection_get_peer of libevent" is not a good summary of the change.

> Please update the PR title to be clearer. "evhttp_connection_get_peer of libevent" is not a good summary of the change.\n\nMy English is not native, I tried to give a more precise definition for this PR. I also applied the changes recommended by you and made a rebase relative to the current master branch.
Is any cast still needed in this case? `&address` *is* `const char**`, right?
